           http://crockettlives.files.wordpress.com/2014/01/immigration-reform1.jpg

'The Republican leaders, such as they are, are under considerable pressure from big-business interests — not the 
small-business interests that are the natural Republican constituency — to open the gates for another wave of 
cheap and easily abused labor.' - Wes Pruden

***

'Nobody, even those who want to get this done, trusts the president. And I understand it, because I don't either.' - 
Rep. Mario Diaz-Balart

It's a new year, and with it comes the inevitable blooming of the gelatinous zooplankton otherwise known as the 
Republican leadership ('Bloom' is usually used for a large group of jellyfish that gather in a small area, but may also 
have a time component, referring to seasonal increases, or numbers beyond what was expected - Wikipedia). 

Despite repeated rejection by a majority of actual American citizens to any immigration 'reform' that includes 
granting 'probationary' (i.e. legal) status to current illegals (i.e. criminals), the prostitutes in situ at the so-called 
House of Representatives have decided instead that it's in their best interests to appease Hispanics, Democrats, 
and the Chamber of Commerce[1]. Call it what they will in Jelly Land, amnesty is still amnesty.

http://crockettlives.files.wordpress.com/2014/01/amnesty-de-jure.jpgFor at least a century, there's never been a 
period when a majority of immigrants weren't Democrats … It's not their position on amnesty that immigrants don't 
like; it's Republicans' support for small government, gun rights, patriotism, the Constitution and capitalism … It 
would be one thing if the people with these views already lived here. Republicans would have no right to say, 'You 
can't vote.' But why on Earth are they bringing in people sworn to their political destruction… (GOP Crafts Plan To 
Wreck The Country, Lose Voters[2])
Immigration reform: Big Business is for it, the Democrats are for it, Obama's for it, and Mexico's for it. What could 
go wrong?
PTG
Original Post: Be Sure You're Right, Then Go Ahead[3]
